title: Fixing 3 Common Problems with Drip Irrigation

tasks.task: Installing and Troubleshooting Drip Irrigation System
subtasks: Checking the garden daily for signs of clogged or malfunctioning drip irrigation
Identifying a clogged emitter in a pot by observing inconsistent plant growth
Locating the clog point in the drip system line, cutting out the damaged emitters, and replacing them with new sections
Drilling drainage holes in a waterlogged pot to improve water drainage
Extending an existing drip irrigation line to a new plant location by trenching and splicing in a new section of tubing
Ensuring proper drainage by adding multiple emitters or adjusting water pressure for drought-tolerant plants
Regularly monitoring plant health and adjusting the drip system as needed to prevent overwatering or underwatering

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Installing and Troubleshooting Drip Irrigation System
